          text run at (0,0) width 745: "The following lines test various combinations of letter-spacing (especially negative values) and opacity. All of the lines"
          text run at (0,20) width 752: "should say \"Hello, world\" but the spacing and background shading will vary from test to test. The W3C specs are fairly"
          text run at (0,40) width 745: "silent on how user agents should handle unusual values of letter-spacing, especially negative ones, which are explicitly"
          text run at (0,60) width 719: "implementation-dependent. Different browsers will render these differently, but hopefully the WebKit ports will be"
          text run at (0,80) width 117: "consistent, at least."
